meanings.definition: In a manner that causes avoidance or dislike.
meanings.sent1: She reacted aversively to the bitter taste of the medicine.
meanings.sent2: The foul smell of the garbage made him react aversively.
meanings.sent3: The cat aversively avoided the bath by hiding under the bed.
meanings.sent4: The idea of public speaking made her feel aversively exposed.
meanings.sent5: The screeching sound of the alarm clock woke him up aversively.

meanings.definition: In a way that is unpleasant or repulsive.
meanings.sent1: The slimy texture of the food made her cringe aversively.
meanings.sent2: The eerie silence of the abandoned house felt aversively eerie.
meanings.sent3: The clown's aversively bright outfit startled the children.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds loomed aversively over the horizon.
meanings.sent5: The taste of the spoiled milk lingered aversively in his mouth.
